citations.narrative:
The facility utilizes cage cards to identify adult dogs. This may create difficulty in identifying individuals in the event of an
escape or damage to the cage card. The facility must use an approved method of identification for all dogs on the
premises.
Correct by 7/3/24.

While the facility maintains records of all dogs in its possession, the facility does not use APHIS Form 7005 to record this
information. Dealers must use APHIS Form 7005 to ascertain that all required information is maintained. The facility must
utilize this form or request a variance for an alternative.
Correct by 6/26/24.

The facility does not currently maintain dates of all treatments and procedures performed on all animals. This may result
in difficulty tracking when changes or secondary problems arise. The facility must maintain records of treatment and
procedures to ascertain compliance with the program of veterinary care.
Correct by 6/12/24.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.50(a) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
The facility utilizes cage cards to identify adult dogs. This may create difficulty in identifying individuals in the event of an 
escape or damage to the cage card. The facility must use an approved method of identification for all dogs on the 
premises.  
 
Correct by 7/3/24. 
2.75(a)(2) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
While the facility maintains records of all dogs in its possession, the facility does not use APHIS Form 7005 to record this 
information. Dealers must use APHIS Form 7005 to ascertain that all required information is maintained. The facility must 
utilize this form or request a variance for an alternative.  
 
Correct by 6/26/24. 
3.13(b)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility does not currently maintain dates of all treatments and procedures performed on all animals. This may result 
in difficulty tracking when changes or secondary problems arise. The facility must maintain records of treatment and 
procedures to ascertain compliance with the program of veterinary care.  
 
Correct by 6/12/24. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n
